module.name: Ft.Xml.Xslt.Exslt.Math_
module.description: Copyright 2006 Fourthought, Inc. (USA). Detailed license and copyright information: http://4suite.org/COPYRIGHT Project home, documentation, distributions: http://4suite.org/

function.name: ACos
function.abstract: The math:acos function returns the arccosine value of a number.

function.name: ASin
function.abstract: The math:asin function returns the arcsine value of a number.

function.name: ATan
function.abstract: The math:atan function returns the arctangent value of a number.

function.name: ATan2
function.abstract: The math:atan2 function returns the angle ( in radians ) from the X axis to a point (y,x).

function.name: Abs
function.abstract: The math:abs function returns the absolute value of a number.

function.name: Constant
function.abstract: The math:constant function returns the specified constant to a set precision.

function.name: Cos
function.abstract: The math:cos function returns cosine of the passed argument.

function.name: Exp
function.abstract: The math:exp function returns e (the base of natural logarithms) raised to a power.

function.name: Highest
function.abstract: The math:highest function returns the nodes in the node set whose value is the maximum value for the node set. The maximum value for the node set is the same as the value as calculated by math:max. A node has this maximum value if the result of converting its string value to a number as if by the number function is equal to the maximum value, where the equality comparison is defined as a numerical comparison using the = operator.

function.name: Log
function.abstract: The math:log function returns the natural logarithm of a number.

function.name: Lowest
function.abstract: The math:lowest function returns the nodes in the node set whose value is the minimum value for the node set. The minimum value for the node set is the same as the value as calculated by math:min. A node has this minimum value if the result of converting its string value to a number as if by the number function is equal to the minimum value, where the equality comparison is defined as a numerical comparison using the = operator.

function.name: Max
function.abstract: The math:max function returns the maximum value of the nodes passed as the argument.

function.name: Min
function.abstract: The math:min function returns the minimum value of the nodes passed as the argument.

function.name: Power
function.abstract: The math:power function returns the value of a base expression taken to a specified power.

function.name: Random
function.abstract: The math:random function returns a random number from 0 to 1.

function.name: Sin
function.abstract: The math:sin function returns the sine of the number.

function.name: Sqrt
function.abstract: The math:sqrt function returns the square root of a number.

function.name: Tan
function.abstract: The math:tan function returns the tangent of the number passed as an argument.
